other_tests.findings: The appendix is dilated up to 13 mm and fluid-filled with substantial surrounding fat stranding. No free air or fluid collection. The lung bases demonstrate dependent atelectasis. A calcified granuloma is seen in the left lower lobe. The liver, spleen, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, stomach, small bowel, and colon are within normal limits. Tiny bilateral renal hypodensities are too small to characterize. The bladder, rectum, and seminal vesicles are unremarkable.
